intro: Trichotosia hispidissima, commonly known as the hairy trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Trichotosia hispidissima is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
